item.title: DataOps: Data Science Empowerment through DevOps, Cloud Computing and Building your Own Applications
Favorite Projects from 2017
item.description:
Favorite Projects Timeline for 2017

Links to Everything Listed

  • January: R-Ladies DC Meetup Group
  • March: B23r for the B23 Data Platform
  • April: New York R Conference
  • May: rOpenSci Unconf and the .rprofile blog series

  • October: Women in Statistics and Data Science Conference
  • December: 3D Printed R-Logo Cookie Cutters

item.title: .rprofile Interview with Jenny Bryan
item.description:
.rprofile: Jenny Bryan

Over the next several months I’ll be teaming up with the rOpenSci blog to release a series of cool #rstats community interviews. The December interview with RStudio software engineer Jenny Bryan went live on the site today.

Read it here .rprofile: Jenny Bryan

About the Series

I proposed this interview series as a side-project for rOpenSci unconf17 which took place in Los Angeles last May. The original idea was to put together a loosely defined set of interview questions for the purpose of “Demystifying the Creative/Development Process of the R Community”. All of the interviews we conducted ended up different, both from each other and from the pre-defined statement of purpose, but I’m incredibly happy with the final products and grateful for the opportunity I had to chat with these folks about their work and life.

I proposed this interview series as a side-project for rOpenSci unconf17 which took place in Los Angeles last May. item.title: Master of Many Machines: Data Science Collaboration Across Jupyter, Zeppelin, and R in the Cloud
.rprofile Interview Series
item.description:
.rprofile: David Smith

Over the next several months I’ll be teaming up with the rOpenSci blog to release a series of cool #rstats community interviews. Check out the first one which went live today!

.rprofile: David Smith

About the Series

I proposed this interview series as a side-project for rOpenSci unconf17 which took place in Los Angeles last May. The original idea was to put together a loosely defined set of interview questions for the purpose of “Demystifying the Creative/Development Process of the R Community”. All of the interviews we conducted ended up different, both from each other and from the pre-defined statement of purpose, but I’m incredibly happy with the final products and grateful for the opportunity I had to chat with these folks about their work and life.
